programme.desc: Documentary examining the personalities of children who have been convicted of murder and analysing what motivated them to kill. Daniel Bartlam was 14 when he attacked his mother Jacqueline with a claw hammer and set her body on fire, while Santre Sanchez Gayle was just 15 when he was paid Â£200 to kill Gulistan Subasi in 2010. Other cases featured include that of brothers Connor and Brandon Doran and their 14-year-old friend Simon Evans, who kicked a homeless man to death for a dare, as well as Robert Thompson and Jon Venables who were 10 when they killed toddler James Bulger in 1993

programme.desc: Six people whose partners are much younger than they are reveal why being of different generations is no barrier to romance. Marilyn's relationship with husband William began when she was 45 and he was 16 and was tested from the start by abuse from friends and neighbours, while Edna (78) and Simon (39) bonded over their mutual love of organ music. Mike (74) is coping with an eight-week-old baby alongside wife Lindsey, who is 41 years his junior, while 58-year-old Gary enjoys clubbing in Ibiza with his spouse Kate, who is half his age

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom

programme.title: The Mr Men Show

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: The Fat Controller oversees a bumpy stretch of track being repaired, but forgets to put Winston's handbrake on, and he rolls off on his own, causing mayhem

programme.title: Noddy in Toyland
programme.desc: Tessie plans to enjoy a honey sandwich picnic, but her bees are scared away by one of Jumbo's sneezes

programme.title: Fifi and the Flowertots
programme.desc: Buttercup and Daisy decide it only rains when the sky is unhappy, and try to cheer it up

programme.title: Mio Mao
programme.desc: The pair spot branches growing out of the earth and wonder what animal it could be

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George and Grandpa Pig watch motor racing on the TV together

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family go to a funfair, where Mummy Pig tries to win a giant teddy

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig gets left behind when his family has a picnic by the riverside

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet searches for a new home for his cousin Mickey

programme.title: Toby's Travelling Circus
programme.desc: Toby is trying to think of a new finale for the show when Delores inspires him by picking out a puppet that looks like Freddo

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: The duo hear there may be treasure buried in Cuddlestown and buy a metal detector

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah try to avoid getting into trouble after spilling jam on a blanket, but their attempts to clean it only make matters worse

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and his guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Gloucestershire to breathe new life into a two-star, 11-bedroom hotel, and reverse the establishment's dwindling occupancy rates. Having bought the property 10 years ago, the owners have found their dreams of a comfortable retirement are beginning to turn sour, and disagreements over the running of the business are hampering improvements

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: World's Worst Holiday Horrors
programme.desc: Ten tales of holiday-makers whose trips ended in disaster, featuring testimonies from the tourists themselves as well as video footage of the incidents. Including a man whose feet came out of the harness during a bungee jump 164ft above a lagoon in Thailand, a honeymooning couple on board the Costa Concordia cruise liner when she came to grief off the Italian coast in 2012, and the terrifying experience of a skier in Alaska

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Chris is heartbroken over Indi and fails to recognise that Spencer is also upset, while Ethan apologises to his children, but forgiveness seems a long way off. Marilyn tells Roo that Harvey would want her to look after Lottie, and John is beside himself with worry because Jett and Nina have been missing for two nights

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paul's election victory celebrations are interrupted by a furious Terese, who threatens to sue him for defamation over the video. Will the new mayor agree to her demands? Meanwhile, Imogen makes a friend in Isaac Woods, a student who is squatting in the Kapoors' house, and Chris forces Kate and Kyle to confront their feelings for each other

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of dead US Marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Highlights of the programme in which Ching-He Huang prepares her own versions of Chinese dishes in an easy way. In each episode she coaches two novice volunteers who learn recipes and serve the results to their family and friends, and offers her verdict on the dishes

programme.title: Prairie Fever (2008)
programme.desc: After snapping under the strain of frontier life, three mail-order brides are escorted back to civilisation by a drunken former sheriff. Along the way, he encounters a conwoman on the run and enlists her help in protecting the trio - but his new friend's abusive husband is on their trail. Western, starring Kevin Sorbo, Dominique Swain and Lance Henriksen. Edited for violence

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paul's election victory celebrations are interrupted by a furious Terese, who threatens to sue him for defamation over the video. Will the new mayor agree to her demands? Meanwhile, Imogen makes a friend in Isaac Woods, a student who is squatting in the Kapoors' house, and Chris forces Kate and Kyle to confront their feelings for each other

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Chris is heartbroken over Indi and fails to recognise that Spencer is also upset, while Ethan apologises to his children, but forgiveness seems a long way off. Marilyn tells Roo that Harvey would want her to look after Lottie, and John is beside himself with worry because Jett and Nina have been missing for two nights

programme.title: NewsTalk Live
programme.desc: Topical debate and in-depth analysis of the day's major stories, with a selection of experts discussing the key talking points of the issues making the headlines, and viewers also having the chance to give their opinions

programme.title: Real-Life Heroes
programme.desc: Real-life stories of bravery and heroism, including the skateboarders who rescued a woman, her sons and two cats from a burning first-floor flat, the shop owner who defended his store from armed robbers and a group of people who pulled a motorcyclist from under a burning car. There is also footage of the Cockermouth floods of 2009, the story of a humpback whale trapped in fishermen's nets in the Sea of Cortez, and contributions from members of the emergency services, who discuss some of their most dramatic cases

programme.title: Ultimate Emergency Bikers
programme.desc: In Birmingham, paramedic Steve Cooper makes a surprising discovery after going to the aid of a woman sleeping rough who is at risk of hypothermia, and there is a remarkable escape for a driver whose van is impaled on railings just outside Moor Street station. Biker cop Smithy tries to work out how a driver hit a horse in North Yorkshire, while Lucy Watson gets more than she bargained for in Cornwall when she deals with a lorry driver who reeks of booze

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New series. The aftermath of Harper Dearing's bomb attack on the NCIS headquarters dominates proceedings. As rescue crews sift through the debris searching for survivors, Abby, Gibbs, McGee and Vance are accounted for, but Ziva and Tony are trapped in a lift. Dearing makes contact after his ex-wife is taken into custody, enabling his car to be traced to an abandoned lot - and the agents arrive just in time to see the vehicle blow up. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: Documentary using interviews, dramatic reconstruction and archive footage to examine the impact and legacy of Arthur Conan Doyle's fictional detective Sherlock Holmes, as well as looking at the inspiration behind the literary sleuth. Forensic scientists, crime historians and experts in all things Holmesian reveal how Sherlock's methods became a catalyst in the evolution of modern investigative techniques, with Dr Henry Lee showing how he used blood evidence to clear a woman charged with the murder of her husband in Florida

programme.title: The Big Benefits Row
programme.desc: A panel discusses the UK's welfare system and why the subject has become such a political hot potato, with questions and contributions by a studio audience. Topics covered include whether the process is being abused and if it should be made harder for the long-term unemployed and recent immigrants to claim benefits

programme.title: Poker
programme.desc: Highlights of a recent tournament from around the world, as a table of card-sharps aimed to scoop the big-money first prize

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: The return of the programme in which Ben Fogle meets people who have moved to inhospitable parts of the world after leaving the rat race behind. He begins by travelling to the swamplands of southern Georgia in America to spend time with 64-year-old Colbert, a former financier who now lives in his hand-built wooden cabin. Ben learns some of the vital skills needed to survive in this dangerous backwater, including skinning roadkill, spearing frogs and drinking swamp water

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to would-be sellers in Cotham, Bristol, whose four-bedroom bungalow has been on the market for four months. She suggests revamping the shabby sitting room to enhance its ambience and updating the mismatched kitchen with a lick of paint, tile jewellery and new flooring, before turning her attention to sprucing up the two bathrooms

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice visits a bungalow in Hove that appears to be deterring potential buyers with its lurid colour scheme

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Cambridge academic Paul Binski continues his fact-finding journey through the history of religious art, visiting St Giles in Cheadle, Staffordshire, and the Free Church in Glasgow to see how Augustus Pugin and Alexander 'Greek' Thomson, two notable Victorian architects, rejected the prevailing industrialism of their era and drew inspiration from the grandeur of the past

programme.title: Thomas & Friends

programme.title: Noddy in Toyland
programme.desc: A dance party is held in the town square, but Tessie's singalong machine breaks down

programme.title: Fifi and the Flowertots
programme.desc: Primrose composes a song for Violet, but the twins break her guitar

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her friends build a sandpit and all goes well until George and Richard's dinosaurs arrive

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: While spending the night at Grandpa and Granny Pig's house, George and Peppa stay up late to help catch slugs and snails

programme.title: Toby's Travelling Circus
programme.desc: Freddo finds a rusty old scooter that Thor had planned to throw away, but he crashes into a big drum while learning to ride it

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: Rat offers the bananas somewhere to stay while Charlie fixes their damaged roof

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet explores a model village

programme.title: Tickety Toc
programme.desc: Tommy and Tallulah make Chikidee a paper aeroplane to fly around in, but realise she does not know how to land

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: The day's news comes under scrutiny from Matthew Wright and the panel, with viewers and the studio audience invited to share their opinions

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits a struggling hotel and nightclub in Essex run by members of the Dolbear family, who spend more time arguing than looking after their customers' needs. She soon detects a battle of the sexes, with father and son Jeff and Andy shouting down mum and daughter Marilyn and Shelley when it comes to decision-making. The garish decor does not help - and to top it off, Jeff remains blind to the business's problems. Alex discovers the rest of the family called her in against his wishes, and he now says he will ignore all her advice

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Dex assumes control of the wedding preparations when he and April are unable to agree on a best man or a maid of honour. Spencer finds Jett and Nina and persuades them to come home, while Casey and Tamara realise their relationship is at a crossroads and agree to go their separate ways

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: It's the day of Josh's Commonwealth Games trials and tension builds as everyone gathers at the Turners' house to watch him in action - but things get off to a shaky start for the swimmer. Meanwhile, Kyle finally asks Kate out on a date and Sonya wrestles with her conscience as she considers telling Toadie the truth about Jacob

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ziva and Gibbs lead the mission to rescue the captured Marine in Afghanistan before discovering that her captor's brothers have bigger plans and are at large in America. Gibbs has to be stopped when he tries to employ methods similar to those used on Kinah and Lala in an effort to gain information, but Vance has a trick that gives the agents an idea of what the siblings have in mind

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: The crusading lawyer takes on a custody case, only for his client to later confess to having murdered the psychiatrist who testified against him. However, when McBride shows up at the doctor's house, the body is nowhere to be found. Mystery directed by and starring John Larroquette, with Marta DuBois, Matt Lutz and Stephen Tobolowsky

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: NewsTalk Live
programme.desc: Topical debate and in-depth analysis of the day's major stories, with experts discussing the key talking points of the issues making the headlines and viewers also having the chance to give their opinions. Presented by Emma Crosby

programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As Britain endures a cold snap, there is chaos on the roads as snow, ice and freezing fog conditions persist. RAC patrols battle to reach snowed-in motorists, while heavy-recovery specialists CMG Rescue Services are out 24 hours a day tackling the aftermath of overturned HGVs and traffic collisions. In Bournemouth, RAC patroller Louise French is first on the scene at a serious accident and has to treat a casualty as she waits for the ambulance to arrive. Last in the series

programme.title: Snowtrapped
programme.desc: From avalanches to in-car burials, this documentary tells seven stories of people who became trapped by snow. Real-life footage brings to life how some survived against both the odds and the elements, how some were found despite having no means of communicating with the outside world, and how others were not so lucky. Including film from the helmet camera of skier Kristoffer Carlsson, who was buried alive under two metres of snow in Verbier, Switzerland, after triggering an avalanche

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: New series. Alex Polizzi comes to the rescue of more struggling hotels, beginning with a visit to Epstein House in Liverpool where owner Patrick Duggan is having problems keeping his business afloat. The property was the home of the Beatles' manager Brian Epstein and Patrick was sure the guest house would be highly profitable when he bought it five years ago, but such expectations have yet to be realised

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following patients undergoing surgery at Liverpool's Walton Centre, which is the only specialist neuroscience NHS Trust. Father-of-three Dene Galloway is rushed to hospital following a sudden headache and neurosurgeon Michael Jenkinson has to operate when the growth in his brain bleeds. Neurologist Nicholas Silver treats 52-year-old Helga Kristensen, who has developed a cluster headache that is causing her excruciating pain, while Iona Davies' epilepsy is not responding well to drugs and her doctors think that surgery might offer a solution

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and Brandon argue, giving Scott and Chrissy a chance to jump in with their bid

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bidders head to Marina del Rey, California, in search of nautical equipment

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, Adam Richman tries to eat a 9lb steak platter in less than 40 minutes in the Sleeping Cow challenge

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman is in Richmond, Virginia, where he goes up against the clock to eat eight super-spicy chicken wings in less than 30 minutes

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around Â£2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson driving the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads. Richard Hammond jumps inside the new Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. Meanwhile, James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Bus for London, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, Formula 1 driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.desc: Raj feels upset about not being in a relationship, so Penny sets out to find a date and introduces him to a girl he can actually talk to. They hit it off, but when it becomes apparent he has been buying her expensive gifts, his friends suspect she is only interested in his wealth

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's old adversary Wil Wheaton returns and invites everyone to a housewarming party. Leonard is eager to go, but Sheldon threatens to shun him if he attends. However, he soon changes his mind when he finds out that Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Brent Spiner will also be there

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Flames engulf the deli with Holly and Jason trapped inside, and as the teenage sweethearts begin to panic, it seems all hope of escaping the inferno is lost. Meanwhile, John Paul vents his anger in the wrong direction after suffering another hellish day at work, and Tom is keen to impress Peri when she invites him to the McQueens to help babysit Matthew

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Robin tries to find her `something old', which she buried in Central Park years previously in preparation for her potential future wedding. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily ask Ted to help them pack for their trip to Italy, and Barney bonds with Robin's father

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, plus interviews with the people who created them. Featuring a musical nun, a `cat woman' crashing her bicycle and a car that catches a golf ball. Last in the series

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town conference. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Tomorrow People
programme.desc: Stephen breaks Ultra protocol during a training exercise, and Jedikiah's mysterious boss insists on meeting him. Meanwhile, Cara and John debate whether going to a nightclub party is too dangerous, and Astrid finds out what Stephen is really up to. American sci-fi drama, starring Robbie Amell, Peyton List and Luke Mitchell

programme.title: Derren Brown
programme.desc: In this one-off special, the master illusionist and showman tries to pull off the perfect crime. He has bet renowned art collector Ivan Massow he can steal a painting from right under his nose. Derren reveals which work is being targeted - a piece by Turner-nominated British brothers Jake and Dinos Chapman - and tells Ivan exactly what time the theft will happen. He even provides a photograph of the person who is going to take it. In a bid to pull off the heist, he recruits a crew - not of career criminals or cat burglars - but of pensioners

programme.title: The Midnight Beast
programme.desc: The guys try to earn more money by entering competitions, and after a run of bad luck, pin their hopes on winning the local Birdman contest. However, their preparations are delayed when they try to help their neighbour Sloman win his wife back, and Andrew trains him up for a big showdown at the bingo hall. Comedy, starring Stefan Abingdon, Andrew Wakely and Ashley Horne

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Simon takes his new girlfriend on a double date, but his principles are tested when she says she will kiss him only if he lets her redesign his wardrobe. Elsewhere, Will considers the idea of spending time with a girl he finds embarrassing and boring. Comedy, starring Joe Thomas, Simon Bird and Hannah Tointon

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: For the first time in his career, Jake has a growing number of cases he just can't seem to solve, and the other detectives worry his run of bad luck will rub off on them. Holt asks Amy to take charge of a community outreach programme for at-risk youths, and Boyle helps Jeffords with a tough personal assignment. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Andre Braugher

programme.desc: Max meets Deke (Eric Andre), a like-minded student when she starts pastry school. Meanwhile, Caroline's first day working in the office is not quite what she was expecting, and manipulates the situation so she ends up sitting at a desk where Nicolas, the attractive owner, can flirt with her. Comedy, starring Kat Dennings and Beth Behrs

programme.title: The Ricky Gervais Show
programme.desc: Karl Pilkington ponders the experience of having kidney stones, and reflects on a variety of other phenomena. With Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant

programme.title: Ugly Betty

Comedy, guest starring Vanessa Williams' brother Chris Williams

programme.desc: A mysterious woman tries to steal Chris's powers and return him to the future. Unable to stop her, the sisters devise a spell which will hopefully enable him to escape back to the present. Meanwhile, Paige decides to move in with Richard. Supernatural drama, starring Drew Fuller

Meanwhile, Winston starts working at a sports radio station, but quickly discovers that his new boss is bad-tempered and demanding

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: With their wedding looming, Robin and Barney try to relax at a restaurant, but plot revenge on a couple who ruin their evening. Ted invites Lily to see the house he has been renovating in the suburbs and shares his plans of moving to Chicago after the ceremony. Meanwhile, Marshall takes Marvin on a last-minute trip to Minnesota to see his family before leaving for Rome

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: New series. The American sitcom returns as the gang travel to Long Island to attend Robin and Barney's wedding, but the couple make a startling discovery about their families en route. Meanwhile on his way back from Minnesota, Marshall realises his mother has posted a picture online declaring he has accepted his dream job before consulting his wife, and Lily realises that Ted hasn't dealt with his feelings for Robin. Starring Josh Radnor and Alyson Hannigan

programme.desc: A security guard catches Brenda red-handed as she tries to steal another portable music player, and the cafe incident continues with Bob wrongly accusing Ruby of taking the customer's purse. programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy tells Carla he is boycotting the funeral, but she orders him to get dressed and they join the other mourners at the ceremony. Leanne suggests Nick move back into Victoria Court while she and Simon stay with Stella, and during a visit to the shelter, Sophie is alarmed to see that Maddie's face is bruised. programme.desc: Hester decides the community needs an old folks' home, and takes her fight to the local council. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Geoff fails to control of a violent outbreak at the bookmakers, and is in awe of Joe as he takes command of the situation. Meanwhile, Peggy can't understand David's reluctance to attend a centenary party at the school

Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.desc: Jessica investigates an old murder case involving close friends and former students in her home town of Cabot Cove. Crime drama, starring Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley and Dack Rambo

programme.desc: A doctor visits Holmes on behalf of his friend and sponsor Blessington, a nervous invalid whose fragile peace of mind has been thrown into turmoil by a series of mysterious events. Drama, guest starring Patrick Newell and Nicholas Clay, with Jeremy Brett and David Burke

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An explosion in the woods is linked to the activities of a villain working out of a local quarry. Meanwhile, Peggy sees an opportunity to make money when rumours abound that a meteorite caused the blast. Guest starring Bill Ward and Graeme Garden

programme.desc: Feathers are ruffled among the staff as a new locum arrives at the hospital, while Ormerod treats the same boy twice in one day - but has difficulty acting on his own advice. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: On the final night of their holiday, David and Linda decide to slip away and meet up for a final drink. They meet at Pedro's bar, but their respective spouses soon put in an appearance. Comedy, starring Keith Barron, Gwen Taylor, Joanna Van Gyseghem and Neil Stacy

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The couple offer their services to a woman in labour, despite their lack of experience - though George does know how to dismantle a motorbike. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.desc: An explosion in the woods is linked to the activities of a villain working out of a local quarry. programme.desc: Jessica visits Quebec to testify on behalf of an old friend wrongly accused of murdering his wife. Guest starring Patrick McGoohan (The Prisoner), Juliet Mills (Wild at Heart) and Claire Trevor (Key Largo)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The story of Wane Leyland from Blackpool, who is searching for the father he has not seen since he was a little boy. Also featured is Wendy Brotherwood, who has been trying to trace her younger sister Sarah. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a family tragedy, 30-year-old Mark Nicholas returns to the town where he grew up, but after 10 years away, coming home is more difficult than he could ever have imagined. An influential mayor is now in charge and there's a claustrophobic sense that everyone knows everyone else's business. As Mark starts to be drawn back into the life he left behind, catching up with school friends and his first love, he must decide whether to stay permanently. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Martin Clunes, Charlotte Riley, Julia McKenzie and Gerard Kearns

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Chappel goes undercover in search of evidence against a child pornography ring in the suburbs and stumbles on a secret more horrific than anything he could have imagined. In his absence, Robinson assumes control of the unit, testing Cheryl and Kirsty's loyalties to the limit

programme.desc: The X-ray machine breaks down, and Carnegie has to tell the hospital staff they won't be getting a replacement - meaning patients will have to be taken elsewhere. Dr Makori gets a crash course in dealing with the locals as she struggles to treat a complex ailment, and a window cleaner is injured while beating a hasty retreat from his married girlfriend's bedroom

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant and his anxious wife - believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness - calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester arranges a short cross-Channel trip to France to help take William's mind off his financial worries - and the pair end up shopping in Boulogne for duty free goods. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: David lies to Amy that his doctor has told him he will suffer a nervous breakdown unless he takes a holiday. He claims to be heading to Spain with an old friend, but is actually planning a romantic reunion with Linda. Keith Barron and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George decides to place his father in a residential home, but the old man would rather stay with his son. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark is beginning to adjust to life in the town and finds a temporary position with the mayor's deputy at the council offices where his mum used to work, but he stumbles across a devastating secret about her that leaves him reeling. Meanwhile, teenage sister Jodie seems to be going off the rails, mixing with a dangerous older boy from school, and grandmother Betty starts a job at a local hotel, where she strikes up an odd friendship with a younger man. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Avigail Tlalim, Charlotte Riley, Julia McKenzie and Gerard Kearns

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Frank Vickers is now firmly ensconced as head of the Vice Unit, with a mandate to institute a Draconian `zero-tolerance' policy. However, events soon take an ugly turn when Cheryl goes missing while on an undercover assignment to expose a pornographer. The disgraced Chappel goes out on a limb to rescue her - but a shocking revelation drives him to the brink of despair. Starring Ken Stott, Caroline Catz, David Harewood, Rosie Marcel and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Unfortunately, it turns out that a key witness's statement went astray during the earlier case - which leads to Frost being suspended from duty. Discreetly continuing his inquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

programme.desc: Carol asks Joe for assistance when suspicions mount against her following the death of a pensioner who she frequently visited. Peggy is annoyed to find a pile of rubbish has been dumped in her backyard and Gina shares her concerns with Carol as she approaches the end of her pregnancy

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient who set fire to his own shop (guest star Tony Slattery) attempts to avoid police questioning by leaping into an ambulance and driving off towards the pier - unaware Alun and a sick man are in the back of the vehicle. Meanwhile, Dr Makori fears for her relationship with Dr Fox when he tells her he has been offered a job in Biafra. Medical drama, with Andy Wear, Paul Fox and Kananu Kirimi

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A wealthy banker goes missing while walking from his country house to the village post office. Poirot, who has acquired a parrot and developed a taste for conjuring tricks, bets the baffled Inspector Japp Â£5 he can solve the mystery without leaving his own apartment. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester thinks William has been unfaithful when he comes home from work reeking of perfume. He offers her a perfectly innocent explanation, but she continues to fear the worst. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: The arrival of their spouses prompts David and Linda to act quickly to get themselves off the hook. Comedy, starring Keith Barron

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Henpecked George finally finds a job, but the line of work could make him unpopular with road users. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Housesitter (1991)
programme.desc: An architect has a fling with a kooky waitress, who takes it upon herself to move into his house and pass herself off as his wife. When the woman he is actually in love with says she thinks the marriage is good for him, he decides to play along with the deception. Romantic comedy, starring Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn, Dana Delany, Donald Moffat and Julie Harris. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark tries to discuss his grievances over the police investigation with Alice, and then goes to the council to ask for Shireen's help. However, when Betty ends up in hospital, Jodie tells him to start focusing on his family and get over his obsession with the past. He agrees, but when a new piece of information about his parents comes to light, Mark knows he must keep pushing until the truth is uncovered. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Charlotte Riley, Goldy Notay and Julia McKenzie. Last in the series

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: As Joe returns to the Vice Unit, his first job is to nail a violent pimp - a case he doesn't think is going to stretch him too much. However, the operation runs into difficulties when the mother of one of the prostitutes involved recognises Vickers and threatens to expose some of his extracurricular activities unless he deals with the case personally. Gritty drama, starring David Harewood and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Conclusion. Maryna stands trial for her attack on Malikov and claims she was acting in self defence, while Walker pays the price for his insensitive handling of the case. Connor takes another look at Sofia's murder, considering whether Walker's obsession with pinning the crime on Malikov has led the team down the wrong path. Crime drama, starring David Hayman and Victoria Smurfit

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The great detective reveals to a startled Watson how he defeated Moriarty and cheated death beneath the waters of the Reichenbach Falls. Period drama, marking Edward Hardwicke's debut as Holmes' indefatigable chronicler

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Two new residents put PC Mason in an awkward position both professionally and personally and, while the village rallies round to celebrate Blaketon's birthday, he gets more than he expected when Gina goes into labour. David decides to learn to play the piano. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, Yorkshire. Starring Joe McFadden, Tricia Penrose and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A wedding reception held on Elsinby Pier ends in tragedy when a fishing trawler sails badly off course. Meanwhile, Adam faces up to a tough decision and the staff at the hospital prepare for a new arrival as Jill goes into labour. Robert Cavanah and Amy Robbins star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth contemplates retiring while on a trip to the Lake District, but shelves his plans when Hastings meets a woman whose collection of valuable miniature portraits has been stolen. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: William and Hester devise an escape plan when Emma's overbearing in-laws invite themselves over to dinner and to stay the weekend. However, entering Nancy's granny flat proves a poor choice of strategy when the pair are mistaken for burglars. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: Judith Chalmers and her TV crew arrive to make a film about the resort, but when David is asked to be interviewed he enrages Amy by adopting an affected accent

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The thought of being a step-grandmother leaves Mildred distraught. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Two new residents put PC Mason in an awkward position both professionally and personally and, while the village rallies round to celebrate Blaketon's birthday, he gets more than he expected when Gina goes into labour. David decides to learn to play the piano. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, Yorkshire. Starring Joe McFadden, Tricia Penrose and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's cousin Emma, a vivacious dance hall performer, turns detective after she is suspected of murdering her lover by serving him poisoned herring. Frasier's Jane Leeves (Daphne) and veteran singer Anthony Newley appear alongside Angela Lansbury, who on this occasion plays Jessica Fletcher's sleuthing cousin Emma MacGill

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A kidnapper demands a ransom from a supermarket magnate in return for sparing the life of a boy who has been reported missing. Frost manages to identify a likely suspect - but with no clues to go on, it looks as if throwing away the rule book may be the only way to save the child. David Jason and Bruce Alexander star

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl is snatched from a troubled housing estate, presenting a fresh challenge for clinical psychologist Dr Tony Hill, who sets about trying to build up a profile of her abductor before time runs out. Unfortunately the case turns into a murder inquiry with the discovery of her body, and the team is left racing to save another innocent life. Robson Green and Simone Lahbib star

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Adam is assigned to help investigate a Soho amusement arcade manager suspected of running a rent-boy operation, but gets in way over his head when he is mistaken for a shy punter. Joe also experiences problems with the case as one of the boys involved leads him on a wild goose chase - just as he thinks he is about catch the suspected pimp. Crime drama, starring Mel Raido and David Harewood

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester decides the community needs an old folks' home, and takes her fight to the local council. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Geoff fails to control of a violent outbreak at the bookmakers, and is in awe of Joe as he takes command of the situation. Debt collector Mick Revill (guest star Martin Kemp) suggests a way to toughen him up, but elsewhere Revill is accused by a local businessman of being involved in some dubious deals. Meanwhile, Peggy can't understand David's reluctance to attend a centenary party at the school

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Rose and Dr Ormerod attempt to rescue a drowning boy during a trip to a hippie commune. Catherine is asked on a date by a local fisherman, while Dr Goodwin discovers the parents of a sick baby are not all they seem after he diagnoses the infant's illness. Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates an old murder case involving close friends and former students in her home town of Cabot Cove. Crime drama, starring Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley and Dack Rambo

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A doctor visits Holmes on behalf of his friend and sponsor Blessington, a nervous invalid whose fragile peace of mind has been thrown into turmoil by a series of mysterious events. Drama, guest starring Patrick Newell and Nicholas Clay, with Jeremy Brett and David Burke

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An explosion in the woods is linked to the activities of a villain working out of a local quarry. Rachel suspects the owner of supplying dynamite to armed robbery gangs, so Joe goes undercover to infiltrate the workforce - but ends up in mortal danger when his cover is blown. Meanwhile, Peggy sees an opportunity to make money when rumours abound that a meteorite caused the blast. Guest starring Bill Ward and Graeme Garden

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Feathers are ruffled among the staff as a new locum arrives at the hospital, while Ormerod treats the same boy twice in one day - but has difficulty acting on his own advice. Carnegie and Catherine struggle to shake off Ken and Alun during their first date at the races, until their full attention is claimed when a jockey falls from his horse on the track. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is asked to investigate the disappearance of a bank's most valued customer, who had been planning to sell the chairman a map showing where to find a long-lost silver mine. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow comes to town, so William and Hester take along their Chinese vase to get a valuation. On their arrival back home the pair surprise a burglar, so Hester tries out her newly acquired martial arts skills. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: On the final night of their holiday, David and Linda decide to slip away and meet up for a final drink. They meet at Pedro's bar, but their respective spouses soon put in an appearance. Comedy, starring Keith Barron, Gwen Taylor, Joanna Van Gyseghem and Neil Stacy

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The couple offer their services to a woman in labour, despite their lack of experience - though George does know how to dismantle a motorbike. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An explosion in the woods is linked to the activities of a villain working out of a local quarry. Rachel suspects the owner of supplying dynamite to armed robbery gangs, so Joe goes undercover to infiltrate the workforce - but ends up in mortal danger when his cover is blown. Meanwhile, Peggy sees an opportunity to make money when rumours abound that a meteorite caused the blast. Guest starring Bill Ward and Graeme Garden

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Quebec to testify on behalf of an old friend wrongly accused of murdering his wife. Guest starring Patrick McGoohan (The Prisoner), Juliet Mills (Wild at Heart) and Claire Trevor (Key Largo)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: The story of Wane Leyland from Blackpool, who is searching for the father he has not seen since he was a little boy. Also featured is Wendy Brotherwood, who has been trying to trace her younger sister Sarah. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a family tragedy, 30-year-old Mark Nicholas returns to the town where he grew up, but after 10 years away, coming home is more difficult than he could ever have imagined. An influential mayor is now in charge and there's a claustrophobic sense that everyone knows everyone else's business. As Mark starts to be drawn back into the life he left behind, catching up with school friends and his first love, he must decide whether to stay permanently. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Martin Clunes, Charlotte Riley, Julia McKenzie and Gerard Kearns

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Chappel goes undercover in search of evidence against a child pornography ring in the suburbs and stumbles on a secret more horrific than anything he could have imagined. In his absence, Robinson assumes control of the unit, testing Cheryl and Kirsty's loyalties to the limit

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the case of a man who has acquired a well-paid but mysterious job - seemingly on account of his red hair. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett and David Burke, with Eric Porter as Moriarty

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar suspects fishy goings-on after veteran music manager Stan Sparrow chooses to hold his wedding reception at the Aidensfield Arms. When Stan is found dead the next day, investigations reveal his demise may not have been through natural causes. Meanwhile, Geoff is baffled by a boy reporting a crime that has yet to happen, and Peggy's conscience starts to trouble her when she hears the lad has gone missing. Guest starring Sue Jenkins

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The X-ray machine breaks down, and Carnegie has to tell the hospital staff they won't be getting a replacement - meaning patients will have to be taken elsewhere. Dr Makori gets a crash course in dealing with the locals as she struggles to treat a complex ailment, and a window cleaner is injured while beating a hasty retreat from his married girlfriend's bedroom

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A dentist falls in love with his young assistant and his anxious wife - believing he has made plans to poison her and thereby remove the main obstacle to happiness - calls for Poirot's help. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester arranges a short cross-Channel trip to France to help take William's mind off his financial worries - and the pair end up shopping in Boulogne for duty free goods. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: David lies to Amy that his doctor has told him he will suffer a nervous breakdown unless he takes a holiday. He claims to be heading to Spain with an old friend, but is actually planning a romantic reunion with Linda. Keith Barron and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George decides to place his father in a residential home, but the old man would rather stay with his son. Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Oscar suspects fishy goings-on after veteran music manager Stan Sparrow chooses to hold his wedding reception at the Aidensfield Arms. Meanwhile, Geoff is baffled by a boy reporting a crime that has yet to happen, and Peggy's conscience starts to trouble her when she hears the lad has gone missing. Guest starring Sue Jenkins

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Snoopy senior citizen Jessica Fletcher visits an old friend, now the Mother Superior of a convent, and finds herself investigating the puzzling death of a nun. Starring Angela Lansbury and Jane Powell

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Mark is beginning to adjust to life in the town and finds a temporary position with the mayor's deputy at the council offices where his mum used to work, but he stumbles across a devastating secret about her that leaves him reeling. Meanwhile, teenage sister Jodie seems to be going off the rails, mixing with a dangerous older boy from school, and grandmother Betty starts a job at a local hotel, where she strikes up an odd friendship with a younger man. Drama, starring Andrew Scott, Avigail Tlalim, Charlotte Riley, Julia McKenzie and Gerard Kearns

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Frank Vickers is now firmly ensconced as head of the Vice Unit, with a mandate to institute a Draconian `zero-tolerance' policy. However, events soon take an ugly turn when Cheryl goes missing while on an undercover assignment to expose a pornographer. The disgraced Chappel goes out on a limb to rescue her - but a shocking revelation drives him to the brink of despair. Starring Ken Stott, Caroline Catz, David Harewood, Rosie Marcel and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Unfortunately, it turns out that a key witness's statement went astray during the earlier case - which leads to Frost being suspended from duty. Discreetly continuing his inquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

Gritty drama, starring David Harewood and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Conclusion. Maryna stands trial for her attack on Malikov and claims she was acting in self defence, while Walker pays the price for his insensitive handling of the case. Connor takes another look at Sofia's murder, considering whether Walker's obsession with pinning the crime on Malikov has led the team down the wrong path. Crime drama, starring David Hayman and Victoria Smurfit

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Moriarty seeks revenge on Holmes for foiling his plan to sell the Mona Lisa, and the pair ultimately fight their final battle at the Reichenbach Falls in Switzerland. Jeremy Brett stars as the titular hero, with David Burke making his final appearance as Dr Watson and Eric Porter as Moriarty. Last in the series

Meanwhile, Alexx discovers Dr Monroe is drinking heavily - and declares her intention to turn him in. Holly Valance guest stars

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac, Danny and Lindsay investigate the death of a doll-shop owner found buried beneath his dismantled stock. Meanwhile, Stella and Dr Hawkes learn a waitress has been killed in a new flat given to her by a customer. Detective drama, with Gary Sinise

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The Machine dispenses the social security number of an uncompromising journalist, and Reese and Finch discover there is a long list of people who would like to see her dead. As well as working on an expose of a mayoral candidate, she is also trying to find out the identity of the head of HR, a shady group made up of corrupt police officers. Guest starring John Ventimiglia (The Sopranos)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a lance corporal, whose body has been found in an empty house, and discovers he had a number of spurned lovers and a $2million inheritance. Ducky and Gibbs interview one of the dead marine's partners, but disagree over whether she is telling the truth. David McCallum and Mark Harmon star

programme.title: Timecop (1994)
programme.desc: A federal agent entrusted with preventing the misuse of time travel sets out to track down a corrupt politician who plans to manipulate history. However, he also faces the temptation to abuse his powers so he can prevent his wife's death. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Ron Silver, Bruce McGill and Mia Sara

programme.title: Justified
programme.desc: Raylan's search for Drew Thompson leads him to re-interview the woman who discovered Thompson's bag, and she reveals information that sends the marshal to the wild Kentucky hills. Meanwhile, having been given the slip by Ellen May, Colt tries to finish the job he started. Crime drama, starring Timothy Olyphant and Ron Eldard

programme.title: Dark Blue
programme.desc: A car belonging to a law student with a debt at the local casino is found splattered with his blood, prompting the team to investigate his disappearance. The trail leads to dangerous loan shark Tim Rowe, who Jaimie tries to trap. As it becomes apparent her safety is in jeopardy, Alex and Carter focus their attention on the gambling facility's floor supervisor in the hope he can secure evidence implicating Rowe

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Casey must confront his former karate mentor, who has become a rogue agent. Emmett's latest initiative causes chaos at Buy More, while Ellie meets Awesome's parents - who have very strong ideas about the direction their wedding should take. Guest starring Carl Lumbly (Alias), Bruce Boxleitner (Tron, Babylon 5) and Morgan Fairchild

programme.title: Committed (2011)
programme.desc: A psychologist recovering from the death of her fiance takes a job working at her mentor's unconventional mental institution. Soon after arriving, she discovers she is officially a patient, not a staff member - and a series of strange events makes her fear she is actually going mad. Thriller, starring Andrea Roth and Richard Burgi

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio and his colleagues investigate a youngster's abduction and find themselves drawn into a dangerous situation at a jeweller's shop while trying to track down the kidnappers. A gun battle ensues - and a member of the team is killed in the line of duty

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac, Stella and Lindsay discover a link between the deaths of a tram driver and a dancer who recently won the lottery. Meanwhile, Danny and Hawkes investigate the murder of a fish merchant and are led to a jealous friend who is resentful that his child was refused entry to a prestigious school

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A man convicted of murder and rape is released from jail because of faulty DNA evidence and subsequently killed, prompting Jane and the team to investigate his death. However, it soon becomes apparent that more than one person wanted revenge on him. Guest starring Jack Coleman (Heroes), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green are assigned to investigate the execution-style killing of a prominent businessman, and discover his wife was having an affair. However, further evidence emerges, suggesting a different motive - and an unlikely conspirator. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio and the team try to find the gang members responsible for a shoot-out in a hospital emergency room. Their inquiries lead them to discover that an unfaithful girlfriend, rather than rival-related retaliation, may be behind the incident. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A roller derby star is killed during a game, but it is unclear which side the culprit belongs to. Meanwhile, an author is found dead with the final chapter of his novel scrawled all over his body, leading the detectives to conclude he may have suffered from a compulsive urge to write. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Armed robbers break into the apartment of lawyer Roland Carson and make off in a helicopter with jewels worth more than $5million. The detectives investigate and, as people who have come into contact with the gems start to turn up dead, they suspect Carson could have staged the whole affair and killed his accomplices to cover his tracks. Drama, starring Gary Sinise and Carmine Giovinazzo

programme.title: Snatch (2000)
programme.desc: An unlicensed boxing promoter and his dim-witted sidekick convince an Irish gypsy to step in for their injured fighter, but find themselves drawn into a match-fixing racket. Meanwhile, the loot from a diamond heist goes missing, leading to a bloody conflict between Russian gangsters and a Jewish mob. Guy Ritchie's comedy drama, with Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro and Stephen Graham

programme.title: Nightline
programme.desc: An incisive late-night news series that analyzes the day's top stories with interviews and reports. It occasionally features program-length documentaries, weeklong series and town-hall forums. The program began in November 1979 as 'The Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage', with Frank Reynolds anchoring. Ted Koppel took over shortly thereafter and it expanded its scope (and took the name 'Nightline') on March 24, 1980. Koppel served as anchor until 2005, when he was replaced by a troika of hosts

programme.title: Nightline
programme.desc: An incisive late-night news series that analyzes the day's top stories with interviews and reports. It occasionally features program-length documentaries, weeklong series and town-hall forums. The program began in November 1979 as 'The Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage', with Frank Reynolds anchoring. Ted Koppel took over shortly thereafter and it expanded its scope (and took the name 'Nightline') on March 24, 1980. Koppel served as anchor until 2005, when he was replaced by a troika of hosts
